API Reference¶

Class Implementations¶

class zenora.impl.rest.RESTAPI(token: str, token_type: str, testing: bool = False)[source]¶

Bases: zenora.base.rest.RESTAPI

create_dm(recipient_id: int) → zenora.channels.DMTextChannel[source]¶

Creates DM text channel with a specified user according to snowflake ID

Parameters

recipient_id (int) – The snowflake ID of the user with whom the DM would be opened

Returns

Zenora DM Text channel object

Return type

zenora.channels.DMTextChannel

delete_channel(snowflake: int) → Any[source]¶

Delete Discord Guild Channel

The snowflake parameter has to be the channel snowflake ID

Parameters

snowflake (int) – The snowflake ID of the channel.

  • emoji_id (int) – The ID of emoji

Returns

Zenora emoji object

Return type

zenora.emojis.Emoji

Fetch Dicord Channel

This has to be the channel snowflake ID

Parameters

Returns

  • zenora.channels.GuildTextChannel – Zenora guild text channel object

  • zenora.channels.GuildVoiceChannel – Zenora guild voice channel object

  • zenora.channels.DMTextChannel – Zenora DM text channel object

Zenora user object

Return type

leave_guild(snowflake: int) → None[source]¶

Leave a Discord server (current user)

Parameters

snowflake (int) – The ID of the Discord Server

Returns

code – Code for response status. Will return 204 on success

Return type

int

modify_channel(snowflake: int, params: Dict) → Any[source]¶

Modify Discord Guild Channel

The snowflake parameter has to be the channel snowflake ID

Parameters

  • snowflake (int) – The snowflake ID of the channel.

  • args (typing.Dict) – A dictionary containing the changes to the current channel. Check this link for all the changes applicable https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#modify-channel

modify_current_user(args: dict) → Any[source]¶

Modify current discord User

Parameters

args (typing.Dict) – A dictionary containing the changes to the current user. This has to be either their username, avatar or both

Example

>>> some_api_instance.modify_current_user({'username' : 'FroggyMan', 'avatar' : 'https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/753561575532658738/0cf89f88a3ba4e226c6f1c72a9242dd8.png'})
User(id=753561575532658738, username=Zenora, discriminator=6423, avatar_url=https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/753561575532658738/380c68e7a6752e347ed875c2e11a05c4.png?size=1024,
flags=0, mention=<@753561575532658738>, bot=True, mfa_enabled=True, locale=en-US, verified=True,)
Returns

Zenora user object

Return type

zenora.users.User

patch_emoji(snowflake: int, emoji_id: int, name: str, roles: [<class 'int'>])[source]¶

Update emoji for guild

Parameters

  • snowflake (int) – The ID of the guild

  • name (str) – Name of the emoji

  • roles ([int]) – Array of snowflake IDs for Roles object

Returns

Zenora emoji object

Return type

zenora.emojis.Emoji

post_emoji(snowflake: int, name: str, image_url: str, roles: [<class 'int'>])[source]¶

Add new emoji for guild

Parameters

  • snowflake (int) – The ID of the guild

  • name (str) – Name of the emoji

  • image_url (str) – Address of image that used for emoji

  • roles ([int]) – Array of snowflake IDs for Roles object

Returns

Zenora emoji object

Return type

zenora.emojis.Emoji

class zenora.impl.factory.Factory[source]¶

Bases: zenora.base.factory.Factory

parse_channel(app)[source]¶

Parses response data from Dicord API into channel objects

Parameters

  • response (typing.Dict) – Discord API response as dictionary/JSON

  • app (zenora.RESTAPI) – Zenora REST API object

Returns

  • zenora.channels.GuildTextChannel – Zenora guild text channel object

  • zenora.channels.GuildVoiceChannel – Zenora guild voice channel object

  • zenora.channels.DMTextChannel – Zenora DM text channel object

Parse response data from Dicord into Zenora’s emoji object

Parameters

  • snowflake (int) – Snowflake ID of guild

Returns

Zenora emoji object

Return type

zenora.emojis.Emoji

map(app) → Any[source]¶

Implementation of the channel mapper.

Maps channel response to object according to channel type.

Parameters

  • response (typing.Dict) – API response from Discord

  • app (zenora.RESTAPI) – Zenora REST API object

Returns

  • zenora.channels.GuildTextChannel – Zenora guild text channel object

  • zenora.channels.GuildVoiceChannel – Zenora guild voice channel object

  • zenora.channels.DMTextChannel – Zenora DM text channel object

class zenora.impl.query.Query(token: str, token_type: str)[source]¶

Bases: zenora.base.query.Query

channel(snowflake: int) → Dict[source]¶

Implementation for the REST API query to get channels.

Parameters: snowflake: int

The channel ID of a Discord channel

Returns: typing.Dict: A dictionary object that will be used to parse the data

into objects

into objects

into objects

into objects

Implementation for the REST API query to delete guild channel.

Returns: channel_id: int

The snowflake ID of the channel.

delete_emoji(snowflake: int, emoji_id: int) → Dict[source]¶

Interface for the rest API query to delete emoji form guild

Returns: code: int

Code for response status. Will return 204 on success

get_emoji(snowflake: int, emoji_id: int) → Dict[source]¶

Interface for the REST API query to get a emoji by emoji_id from guild

Returns: Dict: A dictionary object that will be used to parse the data

into objects

into objects

A dictionary object that will be used to parse the data into objects

Channels¶

class zenora.channels.DMTextChannel(data, app)[source]¶

A DM/Private message text channel object

Returns

Zenora DM text channel object

Return type

zenora.channel.DMTextChannel

property id¶

Returns The snowflake ID of the channel.

property last_message_id¶

Returns The last message ID of the channel.

property recipients¶

Returns The recipients of the channel.

Returns

List of Zenora partial user objects

Return type

typing.List[User]

class zenora.channels.GuildTextChannel(data, app)[source]¶

A server text channel object

Returns

Zenora Guild Text Channel object

Return type

zenora.channels.GuildTextChannel

delete() → Any[source]¶

Delete this channel

modify(args) → Any[source]¶

Modify this channel

Parameters

args (typing.Dict) – A dictionary containing the changes to the current channel. Check this link for all the changes applicable https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#modify-channel

Returns

  • zenora.channels.GuildTextChannel – Zenora guild text channel object

  • zenora.channels.GuildVoiceChannel – Zenora guild voice channel object

  • zenora.channels.DMTextChannel – Zenora DM text channel object

property category_id¶

Returns the snowflake ID of the parant category of the channel.

property guild_id¶

Returns the snowflake ID of the channel’s guild.

property id¶

Returns The snowflake ID of the channel.

property is_nsfw¶

Returns if the channel is NSFW or not.

property last_message_id¶

Returns the snowflake ID of the last message of the channel.

property name¶

Returns the name of the channel.

property permission_overwrites¶

Returns the permission overwrites of the channel.

property position¶

Returns the position of the channel.

property rate_limit_per_user¶

Returns the rate limit per user of the channel.

property topic¶

Returns the topic of the channel.

Users¶

class zenora.users.User(data, app)[source]¶

A user object for API response.

Returns

Zenora user object

Return type

zenora.users.User

property avatar_url¶

Returns the user’s avatar url

property bot¶

Returns the user’s mention (optional)

property discriminator¶

Returns the user’s discriminator.

property email¶

Returns the user’s email (optional)

property flags¶

Returns the user’s public flags

property id¶

Returns The snowflake ID of the user.

property is_system¶

Returns if the user is a Discord System user or not (optional)

property locale¶

Returns the user’s chosen language option (optional)

property mention¶

Returns the user’s mention

property mfa_enabled¶

Returns whether the user has two factor enabled on their account (optional)

property premium_type¶

Returns the type of Nitro subscription on a user’s account (optional)

property username¶

Returns the username of the user.

property verified¶

Returns whether the email on this account has been verified (optional)

Files¶

class zenora.file.File(url)[source]¶

File object for sending file data to Discord in data URI scheme

Emojis¶

class zenora.emojis.Emoji(data: Dict, app)[source]¶

A server emoji object

Returns

Zenora Guild Emoji object

Return type

zenora.emojis.Emoji

property animated¶

Returens whether this emoji can be used, may be false due to loss of Server Boosts

property id¶

Returns the snowflake ID of the emoji.

property managed¶

Returens whether this emoji is managed

property name¶

Returns name of the emoji.

property require_colons¶

Returens whether this emoji must be wrapped in colons

property roles¶

Returns the roles this emoji is whitelisted to

property user¶

Returns the user that created this emoji

Errors¶

exception zenora.errors.AvatarError[source]¶

Raised when current user is changing avatar very fast.

exception zenora.errors.GuildError[source]¶

Raised when the specified guild is either invalid or the user doesn’t have access to it.

exception zenora.errors.InvalidSnowflake[source]¶

Raised when snowflake ID for accessing API is not valid.

exception zenora.errors.InvalidUser[source]¶

Raised when user with specified snowflake does not exist.

exception zenora.errors.MissingAccess[source]¶

Raised when user/bot does not have access to specified channel.

abstract modify_channel(snowflake: int, params: Dict) → Any[source]¶

Modify Discord Guild Channel

The snowflake parameter has to be the channel snowflake ID

Parameters

  • snowflake (int) – The channel ID of the specific channel you want to fetch

  • snowflake – The snowflake ID of the channel.

  • args (typing.Dict) – A dictionary containing the changes to the current channel. Check this link for all the changes applicable https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#modify-channel

abstract modify_current_user(args: dict) → Optional[zenora.users.User][source]¶

Modify current discord User

Parameters

args (typing.Dict) – A dictionary containing the changes to the current user. This has to be either their username, avatar or both

Example

>>> some_api_instance.modify_current_user({'username' : 'FroggyMan', 'avatar' : 'https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/753561575532658738/0cf89f88a3ba4e226c6f1c72a9242dd8.png'})
User(id=753561575532658738, username=FroggyMan, discriminator=6423, avatar_url=https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/753561575532658738/380c68e7a6752e347ed875c2e11a05c4.png?size=1024,
flags=0, mention=<@753561575532658738>, bot=True, mfa_enabled=True, locale=en-US, verified=True,)
Returns

Zenora user object

Return type

zenora.users.User

abstract patch_emoji(snowflake: int, name: str, roles: [<class 'int'>]) → Dict[source]¶

Update emoji for guild

Parameters

  • snowflake (int) – The ID of the guild

  • name (str) – Name of the emoji

  • roles ([int]) – Array of snowflake

Returns

Zenora emoji object

Return type

zenora.emojis.Emoji

abstract post_emoji(snowflake: int, name: str, image_url: str, roles: [<class 'int'>]) → Dict[source]¶

Add new emoji for guild

Parameters

  • snowflake (int) – The ID of the guild

  • name (str) – Name of the emoji

  • image_url (str) – Address of image that used for emoji

  • roles ([int]) – Array of snowflakes

Returns

Zenora emoji object

Return type

zenora.emojis.Emoji
